alert.note: Alert for Cuyama Valley; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches; Santa Barbara County Inland Central Coast; Santa Barbara County Interior Mountains; Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast; Santa Ynez Mountains Eastern Range; Santa Ynez Mountains Western Range; Santa Ynez Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 12:30AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...A line of heavy showers and possible thunderstorms will affect much of Santa Barbara County through 130 AM PST... At 1224 AM PST, Doppler radar showed a line of very heavy showers and possible thunderstorms extending from just south of Santa Maria to Point Arguello, moving east at 45 mph. It will affect most of Santa Barbara County through 130 AM PST. Some of the cells within this line had some rotation, indicating the possibility of weak landspouts. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Santa Maria... Santa Barbara... Lompoc... Montecito... Santa Ynez... Carpinteria... Solvang... Vandenberg Air Force Base... El Capitan State Beach... Summerland... Orcutt... Los Alamos... Isla Vista... Refugio State Beach... Goleta... Buellton... Vandenberg Village... and Santa Barbara Air[port. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
